recipe_def.notes: Bootstrap production path for mare regolith using the simple mining process.

steps.notes: Collection of carbonaceous chondrite regolith from meteorite impact sites. Rare (1-2% of lunar surface) but critical for carbon and volatile extraction. Slower than generic mining due to site prospecting and travel.

recipe_def.notes:
Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path added; replace import placeholder with real production pathway.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing recipe for carbon reducing agent using carbon_reductant input.

steps.notes: Single-step carbothermal reduction from ore to iron pig/ingot.

recipe_def.notes: Direct path from iron ore/ilmenite to iron_pig_or_ingot using the iron_smelting_reduction_v0 process.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for iron pig or ingot

recipe_def.assumptions: Pig iron to steel ingot via refining to billet/slab then casting to ingot.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel ingot v0

steps.notes: Hot roll steel ingot to produce raw steel plate; includes heating, rolling, and final sizing

recipe_def.assumptions: Chain from steel ingot to raw steel plate via hot rolling and final sizing; final product is raw stock for fabrication.
recipe_def.notes: Local production recipe to replace import stub for steel_plate_raw.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for steel plate raw (local)

steps.notes: Mine mare regolith from surface
Screen and separate size fractions
Crush and grind coarse regolith to powder
Extract oxygen and produce metal byproduct via MRE

recipe_def.assumptions: Co-product metal alloy from MRE; refining not modeled.

steps.notes: Cast large bolt and nut blanks in batches (M16-M30 sizes)
Machine threads, hex heads, and bearing surfaces on large fasteners
Heat treat large fasteners for strength and durability
Sort and kit large bolts, nuts, washers by size

recipe_def.assumptions: Non-versioned fastener kit assembled from same process steps as v0; includes large bolts, nuts, washers in M16-M30 range
recipe_def.notes: Recipe for fastener_kit_large (non-versioned) derived from v0.

recipe_def.assumptions: Convert to dictionary-form steps for strict schema compatibility
recipe_def.notes: Placeholder recipe to manufacture a raw metal block from casting and finishing steps.

steps.notes: Draw metal_wire_feed from raw_metal_block using metal_wire_drawing_process_v0

recipe_def.assumptions: Raw metal_block input required; uses drawing die set_basic
recipe_def.notes: Placeholder path: generate metal_wire_feed from raw_metal_block via metal_wire_drawing_process_v0
recipe_def.name: Recipe for metal_wire_feed_v0

recipe_def.notes: Placeholder recipe: produces aluminum_wire from regolith_metal_crude via wire_drawing_aluminum_v0 (ISRU metal -> wire + scrap).

recipe_def.assumptions: Assumes regolith_coarse_fraction is available; mass is conserved to within placeholder losses.
recipe_def.notes: Initial, placeholder recipe to resolve no_recipe gap for coarse_powder.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for coarse powder

steps.notes: Ball mill powder mixture to reduce particle size and achieve uniform distribution; 2% loss as dust
Dry milled powder to remove moisture; ~3% moisture loss
Screen powder to achieve desired particle size distribution; final ceramic powder mixture

recipe_def.assumptions: Assumes coarse_powder feedstock from upstream ceramic mixing; ball milled, dried, and screened for uniform composition.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing of ceramic powder mixture from coarse_powder feedstock. Total processing time ~13 hours. Ball milling time dominates. Used for ceramic parts and refractory production.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ceramic_powder_mixture

steps.notes: Draw nichrome or kanthal resistance wire to specified diameter (typically 1-3 mm) for heating elements
Wind resistance wire into coil elements or straight rod configurations for kiln/furnace installation

inputs.notes: Ceramic powder for forming insulator supports

steps.notes: Form ceramic insulator supports and spacers for mounting heating coils
Mount resistance coils on ceramic insulators, install electrical terminals and connectors
Test resistance values, verify insulation integrity, check for shorts to ground

recipe_def.assumptions: Set of resistive heating elements for kilns, furnaces, and ovens. 20 kg set includes multiple coil elements wound from nichrome or kanthal alloy wire (NiCr 80/20 or FeCrAl). Ceramic insulator supports included. Suitable for temperatures up to 1100-1200C. Power rating typically 5-15 kW total for small-medium furnaces.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing of basic heating element set. Total fabrication time ~18 hours. Includes wire drawing from alloy stock, precision coil winding to achieve target resistance, ceramic insulator fabrication, and final assembly. Critical component for all thermal processing equipment (kilns, furnaces, ovens, dryers).

inputs.notes: Steel for furnace body and structure

recipe_def.notes: Placeholder recipe to manufacture generic furnace; follows common shell->frame->assembly path. Refine with BOM and energy/time estimates.
